personal.name: Bruce Blake
personal.title: Software Engineer
personal.currentFocus: Developing impactful AI-driven solutions, contributing to large-scale software platforms, and deepening expertise in full-stack and systems engineering.

summary.brief: Innovative Software Engineer and Computer Engineering student at Virginia Tech (In-Major GPA: 3.85) with a strong track record in developing full-stack AI solutions, contributing to Google's core internal systems, and excelling in competitive engineering challenges. Expertise spans Python, Java, C++, FastAPI, Angular, OpenAI APIs, and cloud technologies.
summary.detailed: I am a results-oriented Software Engineer deeply passionate about the entire spectrum of software creation, from low-level C++ game engine development to architecting and deploying sophisticated, AI-powered cloud services. My experience includes two internships at Google, where I developed impactful features for company-wide systems like Buganizer, and freelance work where I built a revenue-generating AI voice ordering system from scratch. I possess a strong foundation in computer engineering principles, coupled with hands-on experience in modern software development practices, including agile methodologies, CI/CD, and robust testing. I thrive in collaborative environments and am driven to solve complex problems with elegant and efficient technical solutions.
summary.uniqueValue: My unique value proposition lies in the combination of deep technical curiosity, a practical full-stack skillset, and a proven ability to deliver tangible results. I have demonstrated proficiency in building complex systems (e.g., AI multi-agent orchestration, 3D physics engines) and navigating the engineering challenges of large-scale platforms (Google). This allows me to not only understand theoretical concepts but also to effectively implement and launch impactful software solutions, as evidenced by my contributions to systems used by millions and freelance projects generating significant revenue.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering
activitiesAndSocieties: The Diggeridoos - Virginia Tech Tunnel Boring Team (Software Team Member)

experience.title: Associate Software Development Intern
experience.description: Incoming 2025 Associate Software Development Intern on the Google Play Books team, expecting to contribute to the development and enhancement of the digital reading platform.
anticipatedResponsibilities: Will be involved in designing, developing, testing, and deploying features for the Google Play Books application or backend services.
Expected to collaborate with a team of engineers on platform improvements and new functionalities.
Will work with technologies such as Java, Angular, TypeScript, and Protocol Buffers within Google's established engineering environment.

experience.title: Freelance Software Engineer
experience.description: Led the end-to-end design, development, and deployment of a full-stack AI-driven voice ordering system to automate and enhance customer interactions for a restaurant client.
responsibilities: Architected and implemented a sophisticated voice ordering solution integrating OpenAI's Realtime API for natural language processing (NLP) and Twilio ConversationRelay for seamless real-time voice processing and telephony.
Engineered a multi-agent orchestration system using a Finite State Machine (FSM) and the OpenAI Agents SDK to manage complex, dynamic conversational flows and user interactions.
Developed robust backend services using FastAPI (Python) with asynchronous programming paradigms, ensuring high performance and scalability.
Designed and maintained a menu management system utilizing PostgreSQL for persistent data storage and Redis for optimized caching strategies, facilitating quick data access and consistency.
Implemented Celery for asynchronous background task processing, such as order processing workflows and sending customer notifications (e.g., SMS order confirmations), improving system responsiveness.
achievements: Successfully launched the system, which served over 600 users and generated upwards of $15,000 in revenue for the client.
Delivered a scalable solution capable of handling concurrent calls and complex order scenarios.

experience.title: AI Trainer - Coder
experience.description: Contributed to the advancement of Large Language Models (LLMs) by training them to accurately use various tools and providing expert evaluation of their coding capabilities, with a focus on Swift.
responsibilities: Tasked with training LLMs to effectively utilize diverse software tools and APIs by creating high-quality, instructional data sets including detailed written explanations and illustrative coding examples.
Performed meticulous analysis and evaluation of Swift code snippets generated by LLMs, ensuring accuracy, adherence to user prompts, and conformity with Swift best practices and idiomatic usage.
Provided comprehensive feedback and precise corrections on LLM-generated code to enhance model performance, correctness, and overall coding proficiency.
Authored and curated coding examples and detailed explanations to serve as benchmark training material for improving LLM capabilities in software development tasks.

experience.title: STEP (Student Training in Engineering Program) Intern
experience.description: Developed and launched an ML-powered recommendation feature for Buganizer, Google's internal company-wide issue tracking system, to improve efficiency in issue management.
responsibilities: Created an ML-powered recommendation feature for Buganizer, designed for identifying similar issues based on semantic analysis of titles and existing hotlist data using vector embeddings.

Streamlined critical issue management workflows on Google's internal company-wide issue tracker (Buganizer), a system supporting daily operations for over 2.5 million monthly active users (internal metric for system usage/reach).

Developed the full-stack solution using Java with Google's internal Apps Framework for backend services, and TypeScript with Angular for the frontend user interface, including integration with a queue messaging system for asynchronous processing.

Authored comprehensive design documentation and implementation plans, successfully navigated technical design reviews with senior engineers, and launched the feature internally within the 12-week internship period.

experience.title: Co-founder / CTO
experience.description: Co-founded a social media mobile application startup focused on facilitating event creation and management, leading the technical development as CTO.
responsibilities: Co-led the conceptualization and strategic direction of a social media application designed for users to create, discover, and manage events with existing or new connections.
Directed and executed the collaborative development of the mobile application using Flutter and Dart for cross-platform compatibility (iOS and Android).
Key features developed include a shared interactive calendar, intuitive event creation and joining flows, and real-time in-app messaging functionalities.
Contributed to UI/UX design, backend architecture planning (likely Firebase or similar BaaS), and overall product roadmap.
technologies: Firebase (for backend features like auth, database, messaging - implied)

teamsAndAccomplishments.title: Hackathon Winner - “Memegen”
teamsAndAccomplishments.distinction: 1st Place Winner among 670+ participants (Successfully conceptualized, developed, and presented within 36 hours).
teamsAndAccomplishments.description: Led a team to victory by developing 'Memegen,' a full-stack meme generator web application.
keyContributions: Engineered full CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for meme creation and management.
Designed and implemented a responsive user interface with React and TypeScript, featuring over 20 customizable meme templates and real-time preview.
Developed the backend infrastructure using Node.js and Express, with Firebase for data persistence and potentially hosting.

teamsAndAccomplishments.title: The Diggeridoos - Virginia Tech Tunnel Boring Team
teamsAndAccomplishments.distinction: Member of the 1st North American university team and one of only 12 teams selected worldwide (from over 400 initial applicants) to participate.
teamsAndAccomplishments.description: Contributed to the software development for an autonomous tunnel boring machine.
keyContributions: Developed core control logic for the boring machine utilizing a Finite State Machine (FSM) for operational sequencing.
Engineered and implemented a dead reckoning navigation system to estimate the machine's position.
Created a Graphical User Interface (GUI) using React to provide real-time visualization of the machine's positioning, operational status, and critical data logging.

technicalProjects.name: Custom 3D Physics Engine & FPS Multiplayer Game
technicalProjects.description: Developed a comprehensive 3D physics and game engine from scratch in C++, and built an accompanying First-Person Shooter (FPS) game featuring role-based gameplay, scoring, and leaderboards.
technicalHighlights: Engineered core physics systems including SAT (Separating Axis Theorem) and GJK for collision detection, and rigid body dynamics.
Implemented an Entity-Component-System (ECS) architecture for modular and performant game object management.
Built a custom OpenGL rendering pipeline with shader management for graphics.
Integrated ENet for low-latency, UDP-based multiplayer networking, incorporating client-side prediction and server reconciliation techniques.
Utilized Assimp for dynamic 3D model loading and stb_image for texture loading.
Created a development toolset including a Dear ImGui based level editor.

technicalProjects.name: Full Stack iOS Social Media App Demo
technicalProjects.description: Developed a feature-rich, full-stack iOS social media application (over 20,000 lines of Swift code) to demonstrate proficiency in modern iOS development practices, SwiftUI, and robust architectural patterns.
technicalHighlights: Organized a large codebase (20k+ lines) using MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel) architectural pattern for maintainability and testability.

Implemented comprehensive social features including secure user authentication, real-time messaging (via Firebase), friend/group management systems, interactive calendars, event creation and RSVPs with location services (MapKit), photo/video galleries with cloud storage, and engaging post feeds with pagination.
Integrated push notifications and offline data support using CoreData for enhanced user experience.

toolsAndPlatforms.name: Google Cloud Platform (Pub/Sub, App Engine - Basics)
